sections.content: We form habits in all areas of life, not least in our communication. Think of the last time you greeted a colleague. Did you ask them 'How are you?' If so, what happened next? Did you listen fully to their response or immediately moved on to something else?

How we relate to people and situations can become habitual. Whenever a behaviour becomes a habit, it becomes automatic. We no longer think about it in order to carry it out. In other words, by forming habits, we free up our precious cognitive resources for other tasks, like learning or problem-solving.

In this session you’ll learn about **Reframing** – a technique used to look at the same situation from different points of view. 

Reframing is an important part of your leadership toolkit for 2 reasons:

* It helps you see a given situation in a new way
* It helps your colleagues see a given situation in a new way.
